intro: Deppea inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal deppea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
